block.p: The airspace over the North Pole, once avidly scanned for incoming missiles, could soon see thousands of flights by commercial jets. The demand for the polar shortcut between places like Chicago and Hong Kong is more than adequate to pay for the air traffic control investments that would be needed, according to a joint Canadian-Russian study. As many as 8,000 flights a year might use the shortcut by 2004, according to proponents.
